title: ARAM
body:
I hate it when people dodge in aram - it's random, if you're not prepared to play every champ available, don't play! I got my favourite champ tonight which I rarely get and someone dodges. Got me so mad I'm tilted all night because of one player, one player wrecked my whole night (don't bother replying that it's a game, get over it, because that just doesn't cut it). Even more annoying, the simply solution would be (as previously suggested) to make it so that when someone dodges in aram, they must play the next game with that champ. The current penalty is obviously not enough.

Yes, aram at the moment sucks because all champs are available - who on earth thought that would be a reward, OMG. The thing is, you know (should) this, so again, if you're not prepared to play any champ, **DON'T** queue for a game of aram!!!

replies.body:
Should people be forced into playing a champion they don't want to play? The penalty of repeatedly leaving games and being reported can be losing your account, which is fair. But can you really punish people for deciding they don't want to play a game?

In reality, when someone dodges, it doesn't actually hurt anyone. No game is lost, you get to queue up again and start a new game. 
I only play arams, so yes I definitely understand your frustration, but at the same time I have rejoiced loudly a few of the times my games have been dodged...

I honestly think that champion select should have a dodge vote. This helps teams fight against instalockers, and lets ARAM teams who rolled an awful comp to opt out of half an hour of being poked under tower.


Ultimately though, you can't force people to play a game they don't want to, and why would you try? they are only going to play poorly.
Or hey, let us block up to 3 champions from our ARAM pool, that could be really nice. Everyone hates to play at least one champion, no?

I own all the champs and there are many champs that i like on Sr that  I don't like in aram. I know that I might get those champs and I still play them if I get them (save my rr for my most hated aram champs).  The point is,  you know it's random and you could get any of the available champs, if you're not prepared to do that then don't play aram.

> [{quoted}](name=ROGU3,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=vEI4NVcA,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2017-01-30T17:18:33.525+0000)

Then don't queue for aram.

Give up on an entire game mode, regardless of how much fun you have on it, because you're afraid you'll roll Garen?



............ :/ that's stupid.

If you're going to dodge because of it, yes. You dodging affects 9 other players. People dodging when I've got my favourite champ greatly reduces the fun that i have. Why should I suffer because you're not prepared to play any available champ in a mode that you know is random.

I've actually changed my mind on numerous champs because I've had to play them in aram, next time don't dodge and play the champ you got,  you might learn how to use them and have fun.

How is your enjoyment more important that someone else's?
You missed on playing a champion you like, which is unfortunate, but someone else wasn't forced into playing a (or even THE) champion they hate.

I'm sorry, but being upset because you missed out on someone you wanted isn't really any more important than someone who doesn't want to play the champion they rolled.

Saying that you should only play ARAMs if you're willing to play whoever you roll just isn't right, in my mind. The rotation updates very fortnight, and people have play styles, no? So it's reasonable enough to say, that if they are very good in one area, they won't be as good in another.
I like to play marksmen.
I like to play mages.
I like to play fighters.
I hate playing engage tanks. If I can't roll the engage tank, or trade it, I will seriously consider dodging a game.

At the end of the day, dodging is something WE ALL COME ACROSS, and is very clearly a community wide issue.

Seeing as how many people are willing to dodge there should be a new system implemented that allows these players to not be forced into doing something they don't want to do.

Tl;dr your enjoyment doesn't mean more than anyone else's.

I never said that my enjoyment was more  important, but seriously, if you're not prepared to play any champ available, don't queue for aram. Go make a smurf with only the champs you want for aram, then you've only got to worry about the free rotation. It's not just me that's affected by the dodge, there's 8 other people affected by it too,  but I guess that one person that wants to dodge is more important than the other 9 based on your post.  Play the champs  you get or  don't play aram, SIMPLE!

If riot agreed with you, they wouldn't punish you at all for dodging aram.

Clearly Riot agrees to some extent, because the only punishment is leaver buster, and leaver buster doesn't lead to permanent action against your account. I read that in a Q&A with Riot.

See, you're sensationalising. The example you gave before was "People dodging when I've got my favourite champ greatly reduces the fun that i have."

This example isn't about you and the other 8 people, this example is exclusively about YOU and the dodger. You having someone you really WANT to play, and them having someone they really DONT want to play.

Like I was saying before, I have rejoiced when games have been dodged before. Taking a no poke team into the howling abyss can be a really sucky time.

So you can't just say that you and all other 8 people are inconvenienced, because that's just an assumption you've made that everyone else is like you.

I personally will never hold it against someone for dodging, I wouldn't force them into a game they don't want to play. 

I purchased the beginner bundle when I started playing, without knowing that I was going to go on to only play Arams. Rolling Yi, Garen, Warwick makes me upset. I don't enjoy the gameplay they offer, and nothing in this world can force me to play them if I don't want to. Yet, I enjoy the howling abyss, I just don't enjoy being forced into playing champions that I regret buying.

Please don't tell me to make a smurf... I've spent hundreds of dollars on my account and I'm not starting again just because I don't want to roll Garen...

The punishment isn't more severe because riot can't tell the difference between a dodge and a legitimate dc. In not sensationalising.  Dodgers ate wringing little cry babies, "LG I don't like this champ, soon, soon.  Had better run away".  Aram is a casual game, no one cares if you don't carry. Grow up and play the champ you get

^ That's what the game mode was made for. Same as Nemesis Draft. Don't play that mode if you don't enjoy getting random or champions that you have minimal control over. Rejoice that you can learn to play a new champion.
I don't deny it was made for that, but I don't think people that dislike 1/140~ champions shouldn't play ARAM, even if they enjoy the game mode, but are just unwillingly to play a specific champion/s
Re-roll on that 1 champion, problem solved. You don't need to re-roll on any of the others.
If it's that simple, why is dodging so common?
Maybe because people have no balls to try new champions. The game mode is "all random all mid" so they can get used to playing random champions, thats what the game mode is.

Grow up and let people make decisions?
How are Dodgers whinging cry babies, when here you are. Whinging.

It's not even about not being able to carry. Like you say, it's a casual GAME. Some people just don't want to play specific champions.

Seeing as it is a CASUAL game, why get up in arms about people who don't want to play the champion they've rolled?  
It's 
A
CASUAL
GAME
Yeah, I'm having a whinge. But let's face it,  if you dodge that's what you're doing. Having a cry over the champ  that you get, you don't like so you quit.

Well all the champs are unlocked, so everyone can get anything. 

Maybe they don't realise that.

Maybe they can't read.

Maybe they should try all these fancy champs in bots to see if there is one they like and might buy soon.

Or maybe nothing Riot ever does will make the whole player base happy.

I was under the impression that this is what ARAM is for, to try out champions in a less sincere setting. So, why not play any and all champion now in ARAM, as long as the ocean week is going on.
Champions we don't like are often such we play not well against. The chance and time to get to know them is now!
